gameModel.gameObjects

Class PlayerCharacter

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameModel.gameObjects.MortalObject
      • gameModel.gameObjects.PlayerCharacter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameObject, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PigFarmer, Swordsman

    public abstract class PlayerCharacter
extends MortalObject
    Represents a player's character. Implementations should be of different (in game) classes such as swordsman etc.
    Author:
    Jiaheng Wang (wangjiah) , Chris Chin (chinchri1)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • addItemToInventory

        public boolean addItemToInventory(Item item)
        Adds an item to the inventory to the first open slot. Returns true if Item is added successfully. False otherwise. Most likely reason for failing is no open slots are found
        Parameters:
        item - the item to add
        Returns:
        true if added successfully, false otherwise

      • isHolding

        public boolean isHolding(Item item)
        Returns true if the player is holding the item
        Parameters:
        item - the item to find.
        Returns:
        true if the item is found.

                       GameObject go)
        Uses an item in the inventory on a given target
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the item to use
        go - the GameObject to use the item on
        Returns:
        true if the item has been used successfully
